title: Khalid ibn Abdallah ibn Khalid ibn Asid
summary: Khalid ibn Abdallah ibn Khalid ibn Asid (Arabic: خالد بن عبدالله بن خالد بن أسيد, romanized: Khālid ibn ʿAbd Allāh ibn Khālid ibn Asīd) (fl. 683–712) was an Umayyad prince and statesman who served as governor of Basra in 692–693 during the reign of Caliph Abd al-Malik.
